title: Man Utd news: Paul Pogba shows off toe injury at Old Trafford with crutch and huge bandage
text:
Paul Pogba is still out with a foot injury (Picture: Zenpix)

Paul Pogba did not look like he is near a return to fitness when he turned up at Old Trafford on Sunday with a crutch and a huge bandage covering a cast on his right foot.

The Manchester United midfielder has not played since 30 September with a foot injury, believed to be a cracked toe.

The Frenchman posted a picture on Instagram on Saturday showing him in training, which he captioned ‘almost there’ but this may have been optimistic.

There had been hope that Pogba could be fit again by the time United travel to take on Partizan Belgrade on Thursday in the Europa League, but this looks highly unlikely based on Sunday’s evidence.

Pogba has been out since the end of September (Picture: ZENPIX LTD)

The Red Devils return to Premier League action after their match with Liverpool on Sunday afternoon when they go to Norwich next Sunday.

Whether Pogba will be back in time for the trip to Carrow Road is yet to be seen, but it again looks unlikely as he is still reliant on a crutch.

Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer explained that Pogba had been playing with the injury and was in pain in matches against Rochdale in the EFL Cup and Arsenal in the Premier League, but he is on the road to recovery.

‘He’s been playing through the pain barrier and he’s been criticised left, right and centre,’ said the United boss. ‘But when he came back for Rochdale and Arsenal he could easily have opted to not try to play them, but he wanted to play, he wanted to try to get back.

‘It was too painful so he had that scan but he’s on the way back, he’s mending, he’s recovering.’
